```{r data load, include=FALSE}

#### Load dataset from dropbox

### Data specimen (tous les specimens des especes endemiques du Gabon)

dataset_full <- 
  read_csv("Selection_specimen_GAB_end_28032019.csv", col_types = 
              list(IDGBIF = col_double(),
                   SameAs = col_character(),
                   LatitudeDecimal = col_double(),
                   LongitudeDecimal = col_double(),
                   AccuracyGBIF = col_character(),
                   AccuracyDroissart = col_double(),
                   Accuracy = col_double(),
                   Kept_analysis = col_character(),
                   Updated_data_Trop = col_character(),
                   LowerName = col_character(),
                   `Maximum Day` = col_double(),
                   `Maximum Month` = col_double(),
                   `Maximum Year` = col_double(),
                   `Ecological Habitat` = col_character(),
                   `Ecological Substrate` = col_character(),
                   `Ecological Seasonality` = col_character(),
                   `Ecological Site` = col_character(),
                   ChildHerbNb = col_character(),
                   `Uploaded Trop` = col_character(),
                   DeterminationYear = col_character()
                   ))

dataset <- dataset_full %>% 
  filter (is.na(Kept_analysis)) # kept only georeferenced specimen

## field with problems in importation
problems(dataset) %>%
  distinct(col)

problems(dataset) %>%
  filter(col=="LatitudeDecimal") %>%
  distinct(actual)

problems(dataset) %>%
  filter(col=="DeterminationYear")



### Data species (metadata sur les especes endemiques du Gabon)

species <- 
  read_csv("Gabon_Endemics_species_28032019.csv")
species <- species %>% 
  rename ("IUCN_cat" = UICN_cat_final)

problems(species) %>%
  distinct(col)

### Data full Gabon (tous les specimens d'herbiers géoréférencés du Gabon)
full_gabon <- 
  read_csv("RB_full_TSBC_Trop.csv", col_types = 
              list(ddlat = col_double(),
                   ddlon = col_double(),
                   nbr = col_character()
                   ))

problems(full_gabon) %>%
 distinct(col)

full_gabon <- full_gabon %>% 
  filter (!is.na(ddlat)) %>% # remove non georeferenced specimen
  filter (country=="Gabon")

```

# Endemism characteristics

## Specimens number
```{r nb specimens, echo=FALSE, message = FALSE, warning=F, fig.height = 10, fig.width = 10, fig.cap='Figure 1: Number of taxa with given number of specimens'}

#### Herbarium specimen number by species

herbarium_data <- dataset_full %>% # discard plot data
  filter(KindColl!="Plot_data" | is.na(KindColl))

nb_occ_tot <- 
  herbarium_data %>% 
  count (NameNoAuthors) %>%  # compte le nombre de specimens par espece
  rename(Tot = n) # renomme la colonne "n" en "Tot"

# Avec condition
nb_occ_crit <- 
  herbarium_data %>% 
  filter (grepl("Klaine", CollectorString)) %>% # lignes qui ont comme collecteur "Klaine"
  count (NameNoAuthors) %>%  # nb de specimen par espece avec cette condition
  rename("Klaine" = n)

result_crit <- inner_join (nb_occ_tot, nb_occ_crit, by="NameNoAuthors")


## Plot nb especes en fonction nb de specimens
# Choix des limites de regroupement (nb de spÃ©cimens)
nb_gp <- nb_occ_tot %>% summarise (g1=sum(Tot==1), g2=sum(Tot==2), g3=sum(Tot>=3 & Tot<=5), g4=sum(Tot>5 & Tot<=10), g5=sum(Tot>10 & Tot<=30), g6=sum(Tot>30))
gp <- tibble(Nb_spec=c("1","2","3-5","6-10","10-30",">30"),Nb_esp=unlist(c(nb_gp[,1:6])))
gp <- gp %>% 
  mutate(Perc= round(Nb_esp/sum(Nb_esp)*100,1))

# Plot
gp$Nb_spec <- factor (gp$Nb_spec, levels=c("1","2","3-5","6-10","10-30",">30")) # obliger de mettre cette donnee en facteur pour que ggplot prenne en compte cet ordre de donnees pour ploter

ggplot(data=gp,aes(x=Nb_spec,y=Nb_esp)) + 
  geom_bar(stat="identity") + 
  geom_text(aes(label=paste(Perc,"%",sep="")),vjust=1.6,color="white", size = 4) + 
  xlab("Number of herbarium specimens") + 
  ylab("Number of taxa") + 
  theme(axis.text=element_text(size=14, color ="black"), axis.title=element_text(size=14,face="bold"))

```

  count (FAMILY) %>% 
  mutate (n = as.numeric (n)) %>%

  mutate (prop=round(n/sum(n)*100,1))

```{r taxo fam end stat prop, echo = FALSE, fig.height = 10, fig.width = 10, fig.cap='Figure 3: Families of Gabon with highest proportion of endemic taxa. Number of taxa in the family is indicated in red and number of endemic taxa in the family is indicated in green within the bar'}

#### Most representative families with highest proportion of endemic taxa

full_gab_fam_nb <- full_gabon %>% # calculate nb of species per family within Gabonese flora
  filter (tax_esp != "###") %>% # remove specimens not identified at species level
  distinct (tax_tax, tax_fam) %>%  # all taxa with associated family
  count (tax_fam) %>% # count for number of taxon in each family
  mutate (n = as.numeric (n)) %>%
  arrange(-n) %>% 
  rename("FAMILY" = tax_fam)

end_fam_prop <- left_join(end_fam_nb, full_gab_fam_nb, by= "FAMILY") %>%  # calculate proportion of endemic species within each family in Gabon
  rename ("n_end" = n.x) %>% 
  rename ("n_gab" = n.y) %>% 
  mutate (prop_full = round(n_end/n_gab*100,1)) %>% 
  arrange (-prop_full) %>% 
  filter(n_gab > 10) # filter families with more than 5 species


# Plot - Most represented families in endemics compare to Gabonese flora

X = 10 # The top X families with most proportion of endemic will be dispayed
ggplot(data=end_fam_prop %>% top_n(X), aes(x=reorder(FAMILY,-prop_full), y=prop_full)) + 
  geom_bar(stat="identity") + 
  xlab("Families") + 
  ylab("Proportion (%)") + 
  geom_text(aes(label=n_gab), vjust=1.2, color="lightblue", size = 4) +
  geom_text(aes(label=n_end), vjust=2.8, color="green", size = 4) + 
  theme(axis.text=element_text(size=14, color ="black"), axis.title=element_text(size=14,face="bold"), axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 90, hjust = 1, vjust=0.3))

```

## Altitudinal range
```{r Altitudinal range, echo = FALSE}

### Using "elevatr" package
altitude <- as_tibble(get_elev_point(dataset_sf, prj="+proj=longlat +datum=WGS84 +no_defs", src= "aws"))

range(altitude$elevation)

altitude <- altitude %>% 
  mutate(elevation = replace(elevation, elevation < 0, 0)) # remove negative value for 0 meter elevation

X = 100 # interval of altitudinal representation

# Frequency class altitude according to specimen data
altitude_class_spec <- vector()
for (i in seq(from=0, to=850, by=X)){ # count number of different species per altitude
  altitude_class_spec <- c(altitude_class_spec,nrow(altitude %>% filter(elevation>=i & elevation<i+X) %>% distinct(NameNoAuthors)))
}
altitude_class_spec <- enframe (altitude_class_spec) %>% 
  rename(nb_esp = value) %>% 
  dplyr::select (nb_esp)
a <- seq(from=0, to=900, by=X) # create class name
name <- vector()
for (i in 1:(length(a)-1)){
  name <- c(name,paste(a[i],a[i+1],sep="-"))
}
name <- enframe (name) %>% 
  rename(class = value)
altitude_class_spec <- cbind (altitude_class_spec, name) %>% # combine class name and values 
  dplyr::select(name, class, nb_esp)

ggplot(data=altitude_class_spec, aes(x=reorder(class, name), y=nb_esp)) + 
  geom_bar(stat="identity") +
  xlab("Altitude") +
  ylab("Number of taxa") +
  theme(axis.text=element_text(size=10, color ="black"), axis.title=element_text(size=14,face="bold"), axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 90, hjust = 1, vjust=0.3))


# Frequency class altitude according to putative full range altitude (take into account that species may be present in each class of altitude between its min and max altitude known)
range_alt <- altitude %>% # calculate altitude max, min and altitudinal amplitude per species
  group_by(NameNoAuthors) %>% 
  summarise(min=min(elevation), max=max(elevation)) %>% 
  mutate (range_diff=max-min)

# altitude_class_full <- sum(range_alt$min<X) # count number of different species per altitude
# for (i in seq(from=X, to=800, by=X)){ 
#   altitude_class_full <- c(altitude_class_full, sum((range_alt$min>=i & range_alt$min<i+X), (range_alt$max>=i & range_alt$max<i+X), (range_alt$min<i & range_alt$max>i+X))-sum(range_alt$min>=i & range_alt$max<i+X))
# }
# altitude_class_full <- c(altitude_class_full, sum(range_alt$max>i+X)) # caution X+i does not work here for an interval of 100 m (work for X=50)
# 
# altitude_class_full <- enframe (altitude_class_full) %>% 
#   rename(nb_esp = value) %>% 
#   dplyr::select (nb_esp)
# a <- seq(from=0, to=900, by=X) # create class name
# name <- vector()
# for (i in 1:(length(a)-1)){
#   name <- c(name,paste(a[i],a[i+1],sep="-"))
# }
# name <- enframe (name) %>% 
#   rename(class = value)
# altitude_class_full <- cbind (altitude_class_full, name) %>% # combine class name and values
#   dplyr::select(name, class, nb_esp)
# 
# ggplot(data=altitude_class_full, aes(x=reorder(class, name), y=nb_esp)) + 
#   geom_bar(stat="identity") +
#   xlab("Altitude") +
#   ylab("Number of taxa") +
#   theme(axis.text=element_text(size=10, color ="black"), axis.title=element_text(size=14,face="bold"), axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 90, hjust = 1, vjust=0.3))



# Frequency (number of species) per altitudinal range
range_class <- vector()
for (i in seq(from=0, to=850, by=X)){
  range_class <- c(range_class, sum(range_alt$range_diff>=i & range_alt$range_diff<i+X))
}
range_class <- enframe (range_class) %>% 
  rename(nb_esp = value) %>% 
  dplyr::select (nb_esp)
a <- seq(from=0, to=900, by=X) # create class name
name <- vector()
for (i in 1:(length(a)-1)){
  name <- c(name,paste(a[i],a[i+1],sep="-"))
}
name <- enframe (name) %>% 
  rename(class = value)
range_class <- cbind (range_class, name) %>% # combine class name and values
  dplyr::select(name, class, nb_esp)

ggplot(data=range_class, aes(x=reorder(class, name), y=nb_esp)) + 
  geom_bar(stat="identity") +
  xlab("Altitudinal range") +
  ylab("Number of taxa") +
  theme(axis.text=element_text(size=10, color ="black"), axis.title=element_text(size=14,face="bold"), axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 90, hjust = 1, vjust=0.3))


# Number of taxa known per alitudinal range
ALT=500
sum(range_alt$min<=ALT,range_alt$max<=ALT)-sum(range_alt$min<=ALT & range_alt$max<=ALT) # number of taxa occurring under ALT m elevation
sum(range_alt$min>=ALT,range_alt$max>=ALT)-sum(range_alt$min>=ALT & range_alt$max>=ALT) # number of taxa occurring above ALT m elevation

# Threatened taxa chracteristics

## IUCN categories
```{r threatened stat, echo = FALSE, fig.height = 10, fig.width = 10, fig.cap='Figure 6: Proportion of IUCN categories within endemic taxa'}

#### IUCN categories

end_esp_anal <- end_esp_anal %>% 
  mutate(IUCN_cat = replace(IUCN_cat, IUCN_cat == "CR (PE)", "CR"))

IUCN_cat_prop <- end_esp_anal %>% 
  count (IUCN_cat) %>% # nb of each habitus
  mutate(prop= round(n/sum(n)*100,1))

IUCN_cat_prop$IUCN_cat <- factor (IUCN_cat_prop$IUCN_cat, levels=c("EX","CR","EN","VU","NT","LC","DD")) # obliger de mettre cette donnee en facteur pour que ggplot prenne en compte cet ordre de donnees pour ploter

ggplot(data=IUCN_cat_prop, aes(x=IUCN_cat, y=`n`)) + 
  geom_bar(stat="identity") + 
  xlab("IUCN categories") + 
  ylab("Number of taxa") + 
  geom_text(aes(label=paste(prop,"%",sep="")), vjust=-0.3, color="black", size = 4) +

```{r resampling richness grid stat, echo = FALSE}

#### Extrapolation - Calcul estimator of total species richness (Chao, Walther and Moore (2005))

K = round(seq(1, nrow(full_gabon %>% filter (tax_esp != "###") %>% dplyr::select (tax_tax)), length.out = 1000), 0)
chao2 <- vector()

for (i in 1 : length (K)){
subsamp <- sample_n(full_gabon %>% filter (tax_esp != "###") %>% dplyr::select (tax_tax), size = K[i], replace = FALSE)
subsamp_count <- subsamp %>%
  count(tax_tax) %>% 
  rename (nb = n)
chao2[i] <- length(unique(subsamp$tax_tax)) + ((sum(subsamp_count$nb==1)*(sum(subsamp_count$nb==1)-1))/(2*(sum(subsamp_count$nb==2)+1)))
cat(i, " ")
}

## ---> result: no real plateau of accumulation, show that Gabon is not well collected; inflexion of curve appears for n(specimen) is ca. 30000! so need 30000 specimen to make a quite good estimation of total richness, which is for a grid cell very too much !  So we can't use extrapolation to calculate total richness per grid cell and use % of endemism to calculate estimated number of endemic species per grid cell.




#### Interpolation - resampling per grid cell : use to compare grid cell one to another to highlight grid cell with higher proportion of endemism

spec_grid <- left_join(as_tibble(grid_gab), nb_spec_grid, by = "ID_grid") # integrate nb of specimen per cell to the grid data

k = 100 # number of individual sample randomly
l = 200 # value of minimal number of specimen in a grid cell to compute resampling
rep = 100 # number of times we repeat the resampling procedure
resampling_result <- grid_gab

for (i in 1 : nrow(grid_gab)) {
tot <- vector()
end <- vector()
threat <- vector()
  if (!is.na (spec_grid$n[i]) & spec_grid$n[i]>l) {
    for (j in 1 : rep){
      subsamp <- vector()
      subsamp <- sample(pull(as_tibble(full_gabon_sf_grid) %>% filter (ID_grid == i) %>% filter (tax_esp != "###") %>% dplyr::select (tax_tax)), size = k, replace = FALSE) # pull allows to make a vector from a column tibble
      tot[j] <- length(unique(subsamp)) # total richness
      subsamp <- enframe(subsamp) %>% rename (NameNoAuthors = value) # enframe is the equivalent of as_tibble for a vector
      end[j] <- nrow(unique(subsamp[subsamp$NameNoAuthors %in% end_esp_all$SPECIES,])) # endemic richness
      threat[j] <- nrow(unique(subsamp[subsamp$NameNoAuthors %in% threat_esp$SPECIES,])) # threatened richness
    }
  tot <- sort (tot)
  end <- sort (end)
  threat <- sort (threat)
  resampling_result [i,3] <- mean(tot)
  resampling_result [i,4] <- tot[round(0.05*rep,0)]
  resampling_result [i,5] <- tot[round(0.95*rep,0)]
  resampling_result [i,6] <- mean(end)
  resampling_result [i,7] <- end[round(0.05*rep,0)]
  resampling_result [i,8] <- end[round(0.95*rep,0)]
  resampling_result [i,9] <- mean(threat)
  resampling_result [i,10] <- threat[round(0.05*rep,0)]
  resampling_result [i,11] <- threat[round(0.95*rep,0)]
  }
cat(i, " ")
}

resampling_result <- resampling_result %>% # recapitulative data
  rename (mean_tot = V3, min_conf_tot = V4, max_conf_tot = V5, mean_end = V6, min_conf_end = V7, max_conf_end = V8, mean_threat = V9, min_conf_threat = V10, max_conf_threat = V11)

resampling_result <- resampling_result %>% # remove cells without data for mapping
  filter(!is.na(mean_tot))

  mutate(mean_end = replace(mean_end, mean_end == 0, NA)) %>% 
  mutate(mean_threat = replace(mean_threat, mean_threat == 0, NA)) #replace 0 by NA for plotting specific color for 0 value

```{r correction overlapping}

overlap <- st_within(df_union_cast,df_union_cast)

nbe_elements <- unlist(lapply(overlap, function (x) length(x)))

j <- 2
ids_cell <- unique(df_union_cast$ID_grid)
cropped_cells_list <- list()
for (j in 1:length(ids_cell)) {
  
  df_union_cast_selected <- 
    df_union_cast %>% 
    dplyr::filter(ID_grid == ids_cell[j])
  
  ## which list element contain the cell
  which_element_contain <- unlist(lapply(overlap, function (x) any(x==ids_cell[j])))
  ## if any cell that contain the cell has more than 1
  if(any(nbe_elements[which_element_contain]>1)) {
    ids_all <- unique(unlist(overlap[which_element_contain]))
    ids_all <- ids_all[ids_all!=ids_cell[j]] ## exclude selected cell
    ids_all <- ids_all[ids_all>ids_cell[j]]
    
    if(length(ids_all)>0) {
          df_union_cast_within <- 
            df_union_cast %>% 
            dplyr::filter(ID_grid %in% ids_all)
          
          df_union_cast_within_union <- 
            st_union(df_union_cast_within)
          intersect <- 
            st_intersection(df_union_cast_within_union, df_union_cast_selected) # take the intersection
          
          difference <- 
            st_difference(df_union_cast_selected, intersect) ## take the difference
          
          
          if(nrow(difference)>0) { ## if difference exist
            df_union_cast_modif <- df_union_cast_selected
            df_union_cast_modif$geometry <- difference$geometry ## replace original by cropped cell
            
            plot(df_union_cast_selected$geometry)
            plot(intersect, add=T, col="green")
            plot(df_union_cast_modif$geometry, add=T, col="red")
            cropped_cells_list[[j]] <-
              df_union_cast_modif
            }else{
              cropped_cells_list[[j]] <-
                df_union_cast_selected
            }
          
    }else{
          cropped_cells_list[[j]] <-
            df_union_cast_selected
    }
    

    
  }else{
    cropped_cells_list[[j]] <-
      df_union_cast_selected
  }
  
}

cropped_shp <- 
  do.call(rbind, cropped_cells_list)

ggplot() + # plot bioregions
  geom_sf(data=cropped_shp$geometry, aes(fill=as.factor(cropped_shp$bioregion))) +
